API¶

DNA¶

This module generates BOFsc for the 4 bases of DNA (dATP, dTTP, dCTP and dGTP)

DNA.get_coefficients(path_to_fasta, path_to_model, CELL_WEIGHT=280, DNA_RATIO=0.031)¶

Generates a dictionary of metabolite:coefficients for the 4 DNA bases from the organism’s DNA fasta file and the weight percentage of DNA in the cell.

Parameters:
  • path_to_fasta – a path to the DNA fasta file of the organism, format should be compatible with BioPython SeqIO
  • path_to_model – a path to the model, format supported are json and xml
  • CELL_WEIGHT – experimentally measured cell weight in femtograms, float
  • DNA_RATIO – the ratio of DNA in the entire cell
Returns:

a dictionary of metabolites and coefficients
DNA.update_biomass_coefficients(dict_of_coefficients, model)¶

Updates the biomass coefficients given the input metabolite:coefficient dictionary.

Parameters:
  • dict_of_coefficients – dictionary of metabolites and coefficients
  • model – model to update
Returns:

The biomass objective function is updated.

RNA¶

This module generates BOFsc for the 4 bases of RNA (ATP, UTP, CTP and GTP)

RNA.get_coefficients(path_to_genbank, path_to_model, path_to_transcriptomic, CELL_WEIGHT=280, TOTAL_RNA_RATIO=0.205, rRNA_RATIO=0.8, tRNA_RATIO=0.1, mRNA_RATIO=0.1)¶

Generates a dictionary of metabolite:coefficients for the 4 RNA bases from the organism’s GenBank annotated file, total RNA weight percentage, transcriptomic. Alternately, ribosomal, transfer and messenger RNA relative abundances can be incorporated otherwise the default 80% rRNA, 10% tRNA and 10% mRNA are used.

Parameters:
  • path_to_genbank – a path to the GenBank annotation file of the organism, format should be compatible with BioPython SeqIO
  • path_to_model – a path to the model, format supported are json and xml
  • proteomics – a two column pandas dataframe (gene_id, abundance)
  • CELL_WEIGHT – experimentally measured cell weight in femtograms, float
  • RNA_RATIO – the ratio of DNA in the entire cell
Returns:

a dictionary of metabolites and coefficients
RNA.update_biomass_coefficients(dict_of_coefficients, model)¶

Updates the biomass coefficients given the input metabolite:coefficient dictionary.

Parameters:
  • dict_of_coefficients – dictionary of metabolites and coefficients
  • model – model to update
Returns:

The biomass objective function is updated.

Protein¶

This module generates BOFsc for the 20 amino acids contained in proteins.

Protein.get_coefficients(path_to_genbank, path_to_model, path_to_proteomic, CELL_WEIGHT=280, PROTEIN_RATIO=0.55)¶

Generates a dictionary of metabolite:coefficients for the 20 amino acids contained in proteins from the organism’s GenBank annotated file, total Protein weight percentage and proteomic data.

Parameters:
  • path_to_genbank – a path to the GenBank annotation file of the organism, format should be compatible with BioPython SeqIO
  • path_to_model – a path to the model, format supported are json and xml
  • path_to_proteomic – a two column pandas dataframe (gene_id, abundance)
  • CELL_WEIGHT – experimentally measured cell weight in femtograms, float
  • PROTEIN_RATIO – the ratio of DNA in the entire cell
Returns:

a dictionary of metabolites and coefficients
Protein.update_biomass_coefficients(dict_of_coefficients, model)¶

Updates the biomass coefficients given the input metabolite:coefficient dictionary.

Parameters:
  • dict_of_coefficients – dictionary of metabolites and coefficients
  • model – model to update
Returns:

The biomass objective function is updated.

Lipid¶

This module generates BOFsc for the lipid content of the cell.

Lipid.get_coefficients(path_to_lipidomic, path_to_bigg_dict, path_to_model, CELL_WEIGHT=280, LIPID_RATIO=0.091, R_WEIGHT=284.486)¶

Generates a dictionary of metabolite:coefficients for the lipid content of the cell. Lipids vary from a specie to another. The lipidomic data provides the relative abundance of each lipid specie while the to_bigg_dict allows to convert identifiers given in the lipidomic data to BiGG identifiers for which the metabolite weight is known and can be added easily to the biomass.

Parameters:
  • lipidomic – a dictionary or dataframe of metabolites identified in the lipidomic experiment
  • to_bigg_dict – a dictionary converting from the name present in the lipidomic data to BiGG identifiers. This dictionary is generated through manual curation from the modeller.
  • CELL_WEIGHT – measured cell weight in femtograms, otherwise default
  • LIPID_RATIO – measured lipid ratio of the cell, otherwise default
  • R_WEIGHT – weight of a carbon chain, otherwise default. If the weight of the lipid is not known it will be inferred based on the number of R chains and this given weight.
Returns:

a dictionary of metabolites and coefficients that can be used to update the biomass objective function.
Lipid.update_biomass_coefficients(dict_of_coefficients, model)¶

Updates the biomass coefficients given the input metabolite:coefficient dictionary.

Parameters:
  • dict_of_coefficients – dictionary of metabolites and coefficients
  • model – model to update
Returns:

The biomass objective function is updated.

GAM¶

GAM.experimental_GAM(path_to_data, path_to_model, show_GAM=False)¶

Description

Growth-associated maintenance (GAM) is the ATP cost of assembling macromolecules in the organism. This function calculates GAM from provided path to experimental data. This data includes growth rates on different carbon sources, the associated uptake rate for each carbon source and the secretion rates of metabolic wastes. More information on the format in which to provide the experimental data is available on github.

Parameters:
  • path_to_data – The data file is the outcome of the HPLC growth, uptake and secretion rate experiment.
  • path_to_model – The path to the model, json or sbml formats supported
  • show_GAM – bool, will associated colors with carbon sources for easier display later
Returns:
